Sure, I'd be happy to recommend some musical movies for you.

Based on your preferences for emotional movies and a focus on musical performances, here are some highly recommended musical movies for you:

1. La La Land (2016) - This epic romance musical movie stars Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone in their lead roles. The movie tells the story of Sebastian (Ryan Gosling), an aspiring jazz pianist who lives with his idealistic girlfriend, Mia (Emma Stone)), a struggling actress whose career seems never to take off. The two characters are drawn together by fate, and they embark on a thrilling journey together filled with laughter, tears, passion, and love. This epic romance musical movie is truly one of the greatest romantic movies ever made, and it definitely deserves its place as one of the greatest romantic movies ever made.

2. Mamma Mia! (2008) - This musical comedy film stars Jennifer Lawrence, Anne Hathaway, Rachel Weisz, and Jason Sudeikis in their lead roles. The movie tells the story of Sophie (Jennifer Lawrence), a young woman who has just inherited her childhood home, called Bluestone Farm, from her mother, Donna (Anne Hathaway)), a former rock star whose reputation as a troublemaker continues to haunt her despite the fact that she claims to have turned her life around. In addition, Sophie's teenage brother, Sam (Jason Sudeikis)), is a struggling actor who has recently moved into the Bluestone Farm in order to be close to his acting job. As the day of Sophie's wedding approaches, and as Sophie becomes increasingly worried about the fact that she doesn't have any real friends with whom she can share her feelings about the upcoming marriage, Sophie decides that it would be a good idea for her to invite some of her closest friends, including Sam, who have always been there for her, to come along to the wedding and help celebrate the big day.
